body.p: The Oxygen Feedback search engine supports facets and faceted search functionality. Facets are predefined categories that are associated with search results. Users can select one or more of these facets when searching WebHelp output to narrow down their search results to a specific category or set of categories, and the search engine will only display results that match all the selected facets. This topic describes the process of collecting facets and how to use this feature on your websites.

section.title: How Facets are Collected
section.p: In addition, the topics must have a generated meta tag that stores the topic's categories, subcategories, and values. The structure should look like this:<meta name="topic-facet" content="family/lamiaceae">
In this example, the topic has the family category and lamiaceae value.
The Oxygen Feedback search engine also supports hierarchical categories:<meta name="topic-facet" content="level/advanced/technician">
In this example, the topic has the level category, advanced subcategory, and technician value.

section.title: How to Add Facets to your Output?
section.p: To learn more about facets and how to add them to your website, see How to Configure Faceted Search in WebHelp Output.
